results.brief_description: Wynford Vaughan-Thomas presents the story of the Llanfair-Welshpool line restored by the dedicated work of amateur railway enthusiasts.

results.title: The Great Land of Small
results.brief_description: Tonight, in a quiet forest, Jenny and David are about to embark on a mystical, magical adventure. Aided by Fritz, a kindly hobbit like creature, they are about to enter the enchanted World of Small. Once inside, the kids discover the Kingdom of Small is a place of beauty and wonder and happiness, where no one grows old. Unfortunately, Jenny and David are told that they cannot return home and only Fritz’s special magic can help them. Rated: G

results.title: The Great Lakes - St. Lawrence Lowlands
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Betty Brunke
results.brief_description: A survey of the history and development of the Great Lakes and St. Lawrence lowland area to the early 1950s is presented. The physical structure, climate, vegetation and settlement are interwoven with a glimpse of the farming, manufacturing, transportation and urban patterns of the region.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Betty Brunke

results.title: The Great Karoo
results.creator_credit: Colin Cradock, BBC, National Geographic Society and Trevor de Kock
results.brief_description: The Great Karoo stretches for over a quarter of a million miles occupying most of the inner land mass of the Cape Province of South Africa. It was called “The Great Dry” by early human inhabitants and its harsh climate with extreme temperatures make it a hostile environment for its animals. From the Black Eagle, to the tiniest mouse, the animals survive. This is an opportunity to explore one of the most arid, but most beautiful environments in the world.

results.title: The Great Indian yatra
results.creator_credit: Kishore-Desai, Shweta Kishore and Yask Desai
results.brief_description: At present, tourism is being seen as an economic saviour for the so called “developing world”. However, much of the corporate and state promotion of tourism ignores the hidden costs. This film is an examination of some of the problems associated with foreign tourism in India. The film takes three popular tourist destinations as case studies and at each, examines a failing of tourism in its present form in India. In Agra, the film discusses the inability of the tourist industry to provide adequate income for the vast majority of those formally or informally employed in the tourism sector. Further, it examines the situation where the tourism industry has forced other industries to close, thus resulting in large scale unemployment for those in the industrial sector. In Goa, the film illustrates the lack of meaningful exchange and interaction between the foreign tourist community and the host population despite the fact that cross cultural exchange has long been seen as one of the benefits put forth by promoters of the tourist industry. Part three of the film looks at McLeod Gunj in Dharamsala. Here the the foreign tourist community with its large economic power has become the dominant group in shaping the cultural identity of the region. As a result is is becoming increasingly difficult for the local population to preserve its own cultural integrity.

results.title: The Great Impressionists
results.creator_credit: Steve Isaac, Capital 7 Canberra and Australian National Gallery
results.brief_description: The Great Impressionists exhibition at the Australian National Gallery in 1984 featured works of leading Impressionists such as Manet, Degas, Renoir, Monet, Cezanne, Van Gogh, Pissaro, Gauguin and Seurat. The script, explaining the priceless collection on loan from the Courtauld Institute in London, was written by the Gallery’s Senior Curator of Education, Terence Measham with the express desire to delight and entertain as well as inform.

results.title: The Great Houdini
results.creator_credit: American Broadcasting Company and Melville Shavelson
results.brief_description: A biographical dramatisation created from fact and fiction about one of America’s most fascinating performers and escape artists, Harry Houdini. “The Great Houdini” is a revealing film that provides an insight into his background, his family, his wife (played by Sally Struthers), and his rise to international fame. The memory of Harry Houdini still lives on today. Stars Paul Michael Glasser as Houdini, Ruth Gordon, Vivian Vance, Adrienne Barbeau, Bill Bixby, Peter Cushing, Nina Foch, Wilfred Hyde-White and Maureen O’Sullivan.

results.title: The Great health robbery
results.brief_description: Infant mortality caused by misuse of powdered milk is growing in many Third World countries, despite widespread awareness of the dangers. Outlines the problems in Yemen, and criticises the marketing of powdered milk, which many mothers use in order to appear progressive and Western.

results.title: The Great Gatsby [Ed. version]
results.creator_credit: David Merrick, Paramount Pictures and Jack Clayton
results.brief_description: Edited version of feature film adaption of F. Scott Fitzgerald’s novel starring Robert Redford and Mia Farrow. Credits include screenplay by Francis Ford Coppola and music by Nelson Riddle.

results.title: The Great Gatsby
results.creator_credit: David Merrick, Newdorn Company, Paramount Pictures and Jack Clayton
results.brief_description: F. Scott Fitzgerald’s masterpiece is a story that could only have taken place in the Jazz Age: an era in which recklessness with money, liquor, women and fast cars pervaded the American consciousness. Robert Redford is Jay Gatsby, the dashing, enigmatic millionaire obsessed with the elusive and spoiled Daisy Buchanan (Mia Farrow). The screenplay for this elegant story was conceived with a meticulous concern for language, time and place by Francis Ford Coppola. Cast also includes Karen Black, Scott Wilson, Sam Waterson, Lois Chiles, Bruce Dern, Howard da Silva, Patsy Kensit.
